p: To expedite this search for anti-COVID drugs, several computational studies have used homology modeling or published crystal structures of SARS-CoV-2 proteins, molecular docking and diverse small molecule libraries, to predict potential inhibitors of SARS-CoV-2 proteins including among existing approved drugs for repurposing and natural compounds (see e.g., [ 16, 17, 18, 19, 20, 21, 22, 23, 24]). In comparison, fewer computational studies [ 16, 19] have focussed on identification of potential inhibitors of host factors. In this work, we perform virtual screening of a large phytochemical library specific to Indian medicinal plants to identify potential natural product inhibitors of TMPRSS2 and cathepsin L.
